title: Global Healthcare Recruiter
job_overview:
We are seeking an experienced and strategic Global Healthcare Recruiter to lead international hiring efforts across key healthcare markets—including the United States, United Kingdom, Canada, Middle East, and Australia. This is a high-impact role that not only involves end-to-end recruitment of top-tier healthcare professionals but also offers the opportunity to lead and grow a recruitment division. The ideal candidate is a self-starter with deep healthcare industry insight, global recruitment experience, and the drive to build scalable, high-performing recruitment operations.

Key Responsibilities
Source, screen, and qualify experienced nurses and allied health professionals for placements in hospitals and healthcare systems across multiple international markets.

Evaluate candidates’ credentials, licensing, certifications, and compliance with region-specific healthcare standards and immigration requirements.

Conduct thorough interviews to assess clinical competence, professional background, and cultural adaptability.

Collaborate with internal stakeholders and hiring partners to present top-tier talent tailored to market needs.

Build, manage, and scale a recruitment pipeline that supports international hiring goals across diverse time zones.

Lead and mentor a team of recruiters as the division grows, helping to define performance metrics and recruitment strategy.

Take ownership of the recruitment function, including planning, reporting, and optimization of sourcing channels.

Utilize advanced sourcing strategies including global job boards, healthcare talent pools, digital marketing, and professional networks.

Qualifications
Minimum 5 years of experience in healthcare recruitment, with a strong background in international hiring across at least two of the following markets: U.S., U.K., Canada, Middle East, or Australia.

In-depth knowledge of licensing, credentialing, and immigration processes for international healthcare professionals.

Proven leadership experience or strong interest in leading a recruitment team or division, with the ability to set goals, mentor others, and drive performance.

A self-starter with excellent judgment, initiative, and the ability to operate independently while aligning with broader business goals.

Results-driven and competitive, with a strong track record of meeting or exceeding hiring targets.

Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, with cultural sensitivity and a global mindset.

Proficiency in applicant tracking systems (ATS) and sourcing platforms is essential.

Comfortable working in a fast-paced, remote, performance-based environment.

Willingness to work night shifts to accommodate global time zones.

Availability to work during Philippine holidays, as needed.

Ready to take the lead in global healthcare recruitment?

Apply now and help us build the future of international clinical staffing.
